intro: Silene pusilla subsp. tymphyaea, commonly known as the alpine sand-plant, is a small flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant thrives in open, rocky or sandy habitats, often at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Silene pusilla subsp. tymphyaea is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy yet delicate flowers.
